Package com.brightcove.player.mediacontroller

Class BrightcoveSeekBar

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.view.View
      • android.widget.ProgressBar
        • android.widget.AbsSeekBar
          • android.widget.SeekBar
            • com.brightcove.player.mediacontroller.BrightcoveSeekBar
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.graphics.drawable.Drawable.Callback, android.view.accessibility.AccessibilityEventSource, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BrightcovePreviewSeekBar
    public class BrightcoveSeekBar
extends android.widget.SeekBar
    Provides a seek bar object that also manages arbitrary markers for chapters, ads or some other purpose. This class is heavily based on work done by Kate Kelly and Tim Parsons as part of the Tina project.

    • Method Detail

      • addMarker

        @Deprecated
public void addMarker​(int marker)
        Deprecated.
        Deprecated. Instead use {addMarker(long)}

      • addMarker

        public void addMarker​(long marker)
        Adds a marker to the list of markers. Filtering of pre-roll or post-roll markers should be done by the caller. The seekbar will be redrawn to show the marker.
        Parameters:
        marker - a point in milliseconds on the seekbar which should be marked.

      • getMarkers

        @Deprecated
public java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> getMarkers()
        Deprecated.
        Deprecated. Instead use {getMarkersLong()}

      • getMarkersLong

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Long> getMarkersLong()
        Gets the set of markers. Provided to support saving Activity instance state.
        Returns:
        An empty list of markers if none have been defined, a sorted list containing the defined markers otherwise.

      • clearMarkers

        public void clearMarkers()
        Clears the set of markers.

      • removeMarker

        public void removeMarker​(java.lang.Integer marker)
        Deprecated. Instead use {removeMarker(Long)}

      • removeMarker

        public void removeMarker​(java.lang.Long marker)
        Removes the marker specified.
        Parameters:
        marker - a point in milliseconds on the seekbar which will be removed.

      • getMarkerColor

        public java.lang.String getMarkerColor()
        Marker color attribute getter. Provided for Activity and configuration change lifecycle instance saving.
        Returns:
        The current value of the marker color.

      • getMarkerWidth

        public float getMarkerWidth()
        Marker width attribute getter. Provided for Activity lifecycle and configuration change instance saving.
        Returns:
        The current value of the marker width.

      • setMarkerColor

        public void setMarkerColor​(int value)
        Sets a new value for the marker color. Provided for initialization, Activity lifecycle restoration and configuration change handling.
        Parameters:
        value - The new marker color value.

      • setMarkerWidth

        public void setMarkerWidth​(float value)
        Sets a new value for the marker width. Provided for initialization, Activity lifecycle restoration and configuration change handling.
        Parameters:
        value - The new marker width value.

      • getMarkerHeight

        public int getMarkerHeight()
        Gets marker height. This value is set on the constructor if BrightcoveMediaController.checkTvMode(Context) is true. If it returns 0, the height of the marker will be the height of the progress bar (including padding).
        Returns:
        The marker height set, or 0 if the value has not been set.

      • setMarkerHeight

        public void setMarkerHeight​(int markerHeight)
        Sets the new marker height.
        Parameters:
        markerHeight -

      • setShouldMarkerOverdrawThumb

        public void setShouldMarkerOverdrawThumb​(boolean shouldMarkerOverdrawThumb)
        Parameters:
        shouldMarkerOverdrawThumb - whether the markers should draw on top of the thumb.

        See Also:
